summary:
Chickenpox is a very contagious disease caused by a virus. It creates an itchy rash with blisters all over the body, especially on the chest, back, and face. Other symptoms include fever and headaches, lasting about a week. It's usually milder in kids but can be serious for adults.

The virus spreads easily through the air when someone coughs or sneezes, or by touching blisters. A vaccine can prevent it, and most people only get chickenpox once. Treatment includes lotion for itching and medicine for fever.
title: Chickenpox
